intro: Galium panduanum, commonly known as the creeping bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, prostrate stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Galium panduanum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
